item.title: Pothole on right hand bend on Hayden Lane, 2nd April
item.description:
Pothole on right hand bend, exactly where car wheels have to go when there is oncoming traffic. The pothole itself is on the left side whilst driving north. What3Words location ///files.stay.rounds
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot hole, 2nd April
item.description:
Up a little way into marle hill road quite large fairly deep
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Marle Hill Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven and broken pavement slabs, 1st April
item.description:
Uneven and broken paving slabs, my wife tripped, fell and injured herself on and broke her glasses and boots. Location is not far from the pedestrian crossing heading along St Johns Avenue in the direction of the junction with Fairview Rd, where the wider pavement narrows close to a drain cover and street lamp or sign

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Johns Avenue, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Gap in the cycle path, 1st April
item.description:
On the eastern pavement of Princess Elizabeth Way, between Grevil Road and Tewkesbury Road. Please can you confirm if cyclists are allowed to use the pavement on the eastern pavement when travelling north, signage suggests that cyclists are expected to cross PE Way to the western pavement, and then cross again at the roundabout. If cyclists can use this short section of pavement, please can you add some signage to clarify this? Thank you!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34-45, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: 2 long potholes close to edge of road, 1st April
item.description:
By large Willow tree stump, 2 separate long potholes very close to edge of road. Travelling down Kidnappers Lane from Church Road after the Gas sub station.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long quite shallow pothole close to kerb, 1st April
item.description:
Approx 50 metres below entrance to Lotts meadow travelling down Kidnappers Lane from Church Road direction on right hand side quite close to kerb.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
